description: Rada, after a tense discussion with Alex at Bar 101, resolves not to call for a Truth Tribunal. Inspired by the need for radical change, she accesses Halden's hidden protocol files and prepares to activate the Final Inheritance Protocol.

A sudden citywide broadcast from Halden’s AI—triggered by Rada—announces the activation of the Final Inheritance Protocol: temporary administrative control of BCI subsystems and key city infrastructure is randomly assigned to ordinary citizens.
Council monitors and Directorate staff are caught off guard as administrator codes are securely delivered to citizen devices; oversight collapses as system authority fragments citywide.

With temporary power, citizens lift BCI restrictions, restore rights, and reconfigure access; spontaneous reforms and personal settling of scores occur, fueling both hope and chaos as political alliances realign daily.

In response to days of bottom-up city management and debate, the Council formally recognizes Halden’s death as a planned system reset. BCI design and oversight are devolved to neighborhood assemblies, ushering in a new, uncertain era for Stenograd.
